content.description:
Has good flow to start out and then hits the crux about six feet after the last bolt. It gets run out here and a .25 will probably add the protection you are looking for. It's easy left and right so it's easy to skip the crux of you want.

Second route to the left of the falls. Starts in a belay anchor.
Three bolts, you'll probably want a piece between last bolt and rap anchor. Takes smells to medium pro.

Climb straight up. Holds can get a little muddy 2/3 of the way up which is also where the crux is. Here it is a little unclear how slick the rock will be with feet placements. The rock is pretty smooth on this route but I was able to get one friction foot smear. First climb directly to the left of the waterfalls and to the right of the bolted belay anchors.

See area picture for a visual topo. Four bolts to bolted anchor, could use small to medium gear if you wanted more pro

Start just right of the ledge break, clip a high bolt or put some intermediate gear in the ledge crack, then enjoy continuous interesting climbing for the grade past 3 more bolts and gear as needed. 

3rd bolt line from Louise Falls. Just next to the 2 bolt belay anchor on "Cruise Control".
4 bolts and gear to 2", tree anchor with chains.

Make a few easy moves to the mini roof, make a fun roof pull at 5.6 grade and follow a couple bolts up plugging gear as you see fit, finish left on bolted anchor (shared with the route to the left). Do not try to go up and right towards the tree anchor unless you want significantly harder moves (~5.9) to get there.

5th line of bolts going left from Louise Falls.
2 bolts and gear to 2", bolted anchor.

Good easy climbing (and well bolted) up many ledges with good feet to a bolted anchor.



Bolted line immediately left of a small-mid size tree growing just left of a left-facing corner (see photo). This line is the first of two bolted sport routes left of 'Ryan's Eliminate' (the farthest most left line in Bow Valley Sport 3rd edition). See photo. 

Bolted with bolted anchor.

To the left of the Lake Louise 'waterfall' you willl find several easy 5.5-6 sport climbs which could be augmented by a piece of pro or two. A couple of harder 11 climbs exist on the right of the falls as mentioned in Banff Rock. 
  
 All climbs are 25m and have bolted anchors. A guide service showed up teaching people to lead while we were there mid week. Given the grade, I wouldn't be surprised if that was normal.
